title: Probably incorrect E0282, but diagnostics too bad for me to tell
body:
As issue #25633 mentions, there is very little information given for this error. In my case I get:

```
src/lib.rs:181:29: 181:38 error: unable to infer enough type information about `_`; type annotations or generic parameter binding required [E0282]
src/lib.rs:181         let x_no_j = xdiffs.submatrix(&all_sample_diffs, &all_but_j);
                                           ^~~~~~~~~
src/lib.rs:181:29: 181:38 help: run `rustc --explain E0282` to see a detailed explanation
```

Not sure why, this information is given twice, which is pretty common in my experience. This is separate from the diagnostics issue mentioned above because the signature for submatrix is:
`fn submatrix(self, rows: &Vec<Ix>, columns: &Vec<Ix>) -> MA` 
(fixed, had written without code escaping: fn submatrix(self, rows: &Vec<Ix>, columns: &Vec<Ix>) -> Self;)

where Ix = usize. In other words, to my knowledge, there aren't any unbound type parameters...

when trying to verify this by inserting a line, I get:

```
src/lib.rs:182:13: 182:15 error: mismatched types:
 expected `ndarray::ArrayBase<collections::vec::Vec<f64>, (usize, usize)>`,
    found `()`
(expected struct `ndarray::ArrayBase`,
    found ()) [E0308]
src/lib.rs:182         let () = xdiffs.submatrix(&all_sample_diffs, &all_but_j);
                           ^~
```

which also does not show any unbounded type parameters.

Any help welcome. Sorry the repo where I get this is private, I hope the above information helps.
